CatDescriptText: William Easley, 2028 Plainview Avenue, Brookline, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 5, 1958, pg. 1 with question: "What do you think is wrong with the Pittsburgh Pirates? Do you think that they are using their best ball players at all times?" answer reads: "Well, thats the $64 question.  In answering the $64 question, I might say that they have got so many bosses that they don't know who's who.  I think that Murtaugh is being directed to and he does not have full control of the team.  I don't think he is using the best players.  He is now making a move to bench two of three players.  I say that this should have been done before.  For instance, Baker can play practically any position in infield.  I wonder why he is keeping him on the bench.  That is what I don't think that Murtaugh is in full control."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of William Easley wearing dark pinstriped suit jacket, necktie with dot and diamond pattern with clip, eyeglasses, and dark hat with striped band, standing in front of ribbed metal wall, left store window displaying men's dress shoes, sign in right window inscribed "Pittsburgh Lowes...L.P. Rice..."
